org.modelio.api.ui

Class ModelioDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.jface.window.Window
      • org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.Dialog
        • org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.TrayDialog
          • org.modelio.api.ui.ModelioDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.jface.window.IShellProvider, IModelioDialog
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ModelioWizardDialog

    public abstract class ModelioDialog
extends org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.TrayDialog
implements IModelioDialog
    Dialog template that has :
    • a header with :
      • a left image, modifiable with setTitleLeftImage(Image)
      • a bold title, set with setTitle(String)
      • a logo image displayed on the right side, set with setLogoImage(Image)
      • a message, set with setMessage(String).
    • a user defined content area defined with IModelioDialog.createContentArea(Composite).
    • a button area with user defined buttons defined with IModelioDialog.addButtonsInButtonBar(Composite).
    • An optional message area that display on top of the header area, showing a warning or error small icon and a message.
      See setWarningMessage(String) and setErrorMessage(String).

    • Method Detail

      • setErrorMessage

        protected void setErrorMessage(String newErrorMessage)
        Set an error message that will display in the message area on top of the header of the dialog, with an error small icon.
        Removes the message if null is passed .
        Parameters:
        newErrorMessage - The error message or null to remove the error message.

      • setMessage

        protected void setMessage(String newMessage)
        Set a message that will display in the header of the dialog.
        Parameters:
        newMessage - The message .

      • setTitle

        protected void setTitle(String newTitle)
        Set the title that displays in bold in the dialog header. The title is different from the dialog tray title.
        Parameters:
        newTitle - The header title.

      • setWarningMessage

        protected void setWarningMessage(String newMessage)
        Set a warning message that will display in the message area on top of the dialog, with a warning small icon.
        Removes the message if null is passed .
        Parameters:
        newMessage - The warning message or null to remove the warning message.
